issues.title: Schedule Viewer shows error for location_type = 2
issues.body:
When I try loading a GTFS feed in the Schedule Viewer shows these errors:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12948190/33946325-c7f8c070-e021-11e7-969d-22e1a33fd44f.png)

If I try validating it with the Feed Validator and the same errors are reported:

[validation-results.zip](https://github.com/google/transitfeed/files/1556023/validation-results.zip)

This seems to make a lot of stops not to appear in the map.

When I load it in other route planners (I use mainly the Open Trip Planner) it loads the entire transport network correctly with no errors.

issues.title: GTFS of the Netherlands: unexpected exception and transit feed validator crash
issues.body:
Hello,

I have tried to analyze the following GTFS:

Source : https://navitia.opendatasoft.com/explore/dataset/nl/table/?sort=3D=type_file
Nr. 2 in the list: Global Transport in Netherlands 
Download : 2017 08 31 
Data Date : 2017 08 30 
Data valid until : 2017 11 28

and

Source 2 : https://transitfeeds.com/p/ov/814
Download : 2017 08 31
Data Date : 2017 08 29
Data valid until : unknown

In both cases, I have met an unexpected exception with the GTFS Validator.

Please find the error message in attachment (.TXT files).

Feel free to contact me for any question or precision.
Thank you in advance for your help,
Kind Regards,
Glagolight

[ERROR.txt](https://github.com/google/transitfeed/files/1281790/ERROR.txt)
[ERROR_2.txt](https://github.com/google/transitfeed/files/1281791/ERROR_2.txt)

issues.title: MemoryError
issues.body:
I saw a similar issue here, but yet no solution found. Strangely after it happened, it happened to my old feeds as well, these were able to validate before. 

Also another pc (with same OS, windows 10, same amount of memory, same version of feed validator) works just fine. 

The feed file is about 45MB, and number of stop_times lines is more than 7 million. Below is the content of the "transitfeedcrash.txt".

issues.title: Release new version
issues.body:
Is it possible to tag new version?

cc @bdferris

issues.title: where is the TransXChange to GTFS converter tool?
Stops are not appearing in ScheduleViewer
issues.body:
I am not sure if this is a known issue. It has been awhile since I ran ScheduleViewer.  I am running a freshly installed 1.2.15 on Windows 10.   After loading a GTFS file that FeedValidator shows as perfectly (green) valid, I will see the map with a few of the stops throughout the system showing.  Which is normal behavior that I am use to from the older versions.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7353746/20456625/5c84dd44-ae48-11e6-893c-82b51ffc05b9.png)

However, when I bring up a line, It is not showing any stops.  It is recognizing the stops as it is counting the stops and on feeds that do not have a shapes.txt file, it is properly drawing the line.  

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7353746/20456683/270ccb26-ae49-11e6-96e0-8bb36aae0b81.png)

This is both with and without running ScheduleViewer as an administrator and this is happening both with and without a Google Maps API key.

issues.title: hello,I want to add shape,but the trip haven't the shape_id
issues.body:
when I add shape_point by using addpoint
and create zip
but

the trip.txt haven't shape_id

issues.title: Transit Feed Crash
issues.body:
[transitfeedcrash.txt](https://github.com/google/transitfeed/files/577378/transitfeedcrash.txt)

how i know where it is crashed???

issues.title: Summertime -> Wintertime
issues.body: Feedvalidator can't be run on the Saturday before going to wintertime.

issues.title: Time limit set at 999:59:59
issues.body: The time limit is set to 999:59:59, however, cannot see that this violates any definition of GTFS. Trying to implement GTFS into cargo transport and thus, time on a journey exceeds this limit regularly. Suggest to increase that limit to 2999:59:59 .

issues.title: Crash when merging feeds consisting only of calendar_dates.txt (not calendar.txt)
issues.body:
The merge tool crashes with the following error:

`InvalidValue: Invalid value 0 in field start_date`

I have identified the root cause of this issue, and fixed this in my fork. Will submit a pull request shortly.

commits.message:
Remove expiry failure in tests

Tests are failing due to a warning that the feed is expired. This extends the feed to 2025,
as a quick fix to the problem.

pull_requests.title: Fix for truncating periods with undefined date range. Fixes #413
pull_requests.body:
max(0, None) resulted in start_date being set to 0 (integer). This crashed at a later point
when trying to parse the date string 0 (int).
Now explicitly handling None when truncating.

issues.title: Python 3 support.
issues.body: Would be great to have it.

issues.title: In pypy: Exception OperationalError (...) ignored
issues.body:
In pypy (2.5.1), I get the following on stderr

```
Exception OperationalError: OperationalError(u'unable to close due to unfinalized statements or unfinished backups',) in method __del__ of <transitfeed.schedule.Schedule object at 0x00000001076f6758> ignored
```

This seems to be related to cleaning up a Schedule object and possibly the use of weak references. It doesn't change the behavior of our programs as far as I can see, except that we get output on stderr. This will make our tool chain think that something broke, when it fact it didn't.

Note this issue in the pypy forum, where a sqlite library may have had a similar issue; https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/issues/2006/operationalerror-when-there-are-a-lot-of. I don't quite get it.

issues.title: When trying to run kmlwriter.py, getting ImportError: No module named extensions.googletransit
issues.body:
Following error received when trying to run `kmlwriter.py`:
`ImportError: No module named extensions.googletransit`

Possible reasons: something is wrong with `pytz` in `requirements.txt`. When I ran `pip install requirements.txt`, I got following error: 

```
Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement requirements.txt (from versions: )
No matching distribution found for requirements.txt
```

I "manually" installed `pytz` by running `pip install pytz`, which seemed to work. Still, though, `kmlwriter.py` failed.

issues.title: No support for frequencies?
issues.body:
I've used Schedule Viewer to check on a GTFS feed that mostly uses frequencies rather than time tables and found that the viewer doesn't calculate stop times from frequency.txt file but shows stop times based on travel times instead.
Doesn't it support frequency schedules?

issues.title: Add support for translations.txt
issues.body:
Hello

The current version of the feed validator does not support the translations.txt file. This file is part of the extensions to GTFS, here:
https://support.google.com/transitpartners/answer/2450962

> In regions that have multiple official languages, transit agencies/operators typically have language-specific names and web pages.  In order to best serve riders in those regions, it is useful for the GTFS feed to include these language-dependent values.

Regards

issues.title: Profiling seems to cause an issue.
Fields in stop_times removed by merge tool
issues.body: Hi the merge tool seems to remove all the values from timepoints field, and all the 0 values from pickup_type and drop_off_type fields in stop_times.txt. Would you please consider delivering a patch so that those values can be retained? Many thanks.

issues.title: Doc: ScheduleViewer has some internal localhost binding config
issues.body:
https://github.com/google/transitfeed/wiki/ScheduleViewer

It would be nice if the documentation mentioned that, saving us from messing with every firewall level to find out it's the config.

P.S. I still don't know where ScheduleViewer binds to localhost preventing external requests from coming in.

Error: new-line character seen in unquoted field - do you need to open the file in universal-newline mode?

issues.title: Does not validate all the required fields to be present on routes.txt
issues.body:
I noticed that feedvalidator does not validate that all the required fields are in place in input data? I would have expected that it reports 'Missing value for column column name (E7)' for all the missing fiels, which are specified to be required fields in GTFS reference (https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference).

As a testdata I used sample-feed.zip as a base (from here https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/examples/sample-feed.zip).
When running that against feedvalidator, I get just some warnings, which is ok.

I modified some lines of routes.txt to not have route_short_name or route_long_name (sample-feed-missing-routenames.zip) or route_id (sample-feed-no-routeid.zip). Oh, I cannot upload them here, well, this was what I did:

No route id:
route_id,agency_id,route_short_name,route_long_name,route_desc,route_type,route_url,route_color,route_text_color
,DTA,10,Airport - Bullfrog,,3,,,
-rest of file as in original-

No route_short/long_name
route_id,agency_id,route_short_name,route_long_name,route_desc,route_type,route_url,route_color,route_text_color
AB,DTA,,Airport - Bullfrog,,3,,,
BFC,DTA,20,,,3,,,
-rest of file as in original-

If you run feedvalidator against sample-feed-missing-routenames.zip, you get just the same warnings as with original zip-file. No errors from required missing route_short/long_name-fields. However, if you run validation against sample-feed-no-routeid.zip, it gives you a valid error as it should.

I would have expected it to notify errors on both zips, since required fields are missing.

ps. I was trying to see if I'm missing some command line argument or extension, but I think I'm using it correctly? Just like this -> feedvalidator.exe --limit_per_type=50  sample-feed-missing-routenames.zip

issues.title: Add "timepoint" in stops_times.txt to validator as official field
issues.body:
"Timepoint" field was added to GTFS in Feb 2, 2015 revision to GTFS spec (see [discussion](https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/gtfs-changes/Ah-J9JP2rJY) and [spec](https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference#stop_timestxt-)).

Currently, the validator still flags "timepoint" as an unrecognized column:

> Unrecognized Column
> 
> Unrecognized column timepoint in file stop_times.txt. This might be a misspelled column name (capitalization matters!). Or it could be extra information (such as a proposed feed extension) that the validator doesn't know about yet. Extra information is fine; this warning is here to catch misspelled optional column names.
> in line 1 of stop_times.txt
> trip_id arrival_time    departure_time  stop_id stop_sequence   pickup_type drop_off_type   timepoint

commits.message: Update simplejson to json

issues.title: Error processing feed with unexpected newline character
issues.body:
Running feedvalidator.py on the [San Francisco Bay Ferries GTFS](http://data.trilliumtransit.com/gtfs/sfbay-ferries-ca-us/sfbay-ferries-ca-us.zip) currently returns the error:

```
Error: new-line character seen in unquoted field - do you need to open the file in universal-newline mode?
```

The calendar.txt file seems to be the culprit.

issues.title: pip install behind a version
issues.body: Latest release is 1.2.15, but `pip install transitfeed` installs 1.2.14.

issues.title: route_short_name max length 6 characters?
issues.body:
Hello,

Validating data from the [MBTA](http://mbta.com/) which contains some `route_short_names` that caused the following error:

> Invalid value Shuttle in field route_short_name This route_short_name is relatively long, which probably means that it contains a place name. You should only use this field to hold a short code that riders use to identify a route. If this route doesn't have such a code, it's OK to leave this field empty.
> Invalid value 441/442 in field route_short_name This route_short_name is relatively long, which probably means that it contains a place name. You should only use this field to hold a short code that riders use to identify a route. If this route doesn't have such a code, it's OK to leave this field empty.
> Invalid value 214/216 in field route_short_name This route_short_name is relatively long, which probably means that it contains a place name. You should only use this field to hold a short code that riders use to identify a route. If this route doesn't have such a code, it's OK to leave this field empty.
> Invalid value 116/117 in field route_short_name This route_short_name is relatively long, which probably means that it contains a place name. You should only use this field to hold a short code that riders use to identify a route. If this route doesn't have such a code, it's OK to leave this field empty.

Since it doesn't seem like this is likely to be a configuration that is too out of the ordinary for transit agencies to use, I am wondering if the `route_short_name` needs to be so short. The gtfs spec itself doesn't specify a max length for this parameter.

Thanks,

-Raphael

issues.title: Feed Validator Does Not Find "Stops Match Shape in the Wrong Order" Issues
issues.body:
When shapes are uploaded to/fetched by the Google Transit Partner dashboard it will find Stops Match Shape in the Wrong Order issues. However, when those same GTFS files are checked using the feedvalidator_googletransit.exe (Windows) those warnings do not show. Could this be added to make this a more consistent experience?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9285423/5826053/ce60a4e2-a0bd-11e4-9e03-850a01ad9a55.png)

Jython SQLite support

Use zxJDBC if available in order to support Jython, which lacks native
SQLite. Fixes google/transitfeed#245.

pull_requests.title: Adding Google Transit Extension: platform_code
pull_requests.body:
Adding Google Transit Extension: platform_code

From reference
https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference/gtfs-extensions#station-platforms

**Field Name:** platform_code	

**Required:** Optional

**Details:**
Indicates the platform identifier for a platform stop. This should be just the platform identifier (eg. "G" or "3"). Words like “platform” or "track" (or the feed’s language-specific equivalent) should not be included. This allows feed consumers to more easily internationalize and localize the platform identifier into other languages.

Currently is showing:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1817333/25975058/c5d83848-3671-11e7-970f-03a5e3aeedd1.png)
